title: Variables
text: Represent the number of each type of cash using variables. The number of $5 bills is three times the number of $10 bills, so you can represent this as 3t(where t is ten dollar bills).

title: Multiplication
text: Multiply the number of each cash type(in variable form) by its respective value.

title: Conversion
text: Now, translate the expressions that were multiplied by their cash values into a single equation. This will be $$175=15t+10t$$

title: Substitution
text: Plug t into the original relationship between the cash to find 3t.

title: Calculation
text: The answer is 21 $5 bills and 7 $10 bills.
